text.title: part2_Wikinews attends ComicCon in Bangalore, India

p.s: Who is your inspiration ?

When it comes to webcomics , my inspiration has to be Shen from
Blue Chair
, and it is also called Shen Comics now .

Then ,
The Awkward Yeti
— Nick Seluk , then Sarah Andersen 's comics —
Sarah 's Scribbles
.
Yeah , those are pretty much it .
I only read the mainstream ones before I decided to start making my own , So I do n't have a long list .
Where did you upload your first comic ?
Are you self-taught ?
Yes !
For the most part , yeah .
I mean , I am studying animation design , but when it comes to drawing , I completely just taught myself .
Do you discuss your ideas before penning them down ?
With some people .
I have a couple of friends , I talk to sometimes , but for most ideas , no .
I just go for it .
Yeah .
What tools do you use to create your comics ?

I draw in
Adobe
Photoshop
, and I use a Wiacom tablet .
I wanted to know what is your official website .
I do n't have an official website but it is all over on Facebook or Instagram and even on Webtoons , but I do n't have a website yet , but I am planning to start one soon .
What are some of your hobbies ?
Oh , it is just drawing , animating .

I play
football
,
basketball
, but mostly just drawing and animating .
There is one character in your comic , which is called as[ ... ]
Kabeer .
Why did you name him Kabeer ?
So Kabeer is a religiously ambiguous name .
Kabeer is n't overly seen as a Hindu or a Muslim or anything .

So it is a middle point and I wanted to keep a character that everyone can relate to , not just someone who belongs to a certain religion . So for that ambiguity , that is why I came up with the name , plus I really like the name .
That was actually , probably the main reason .
There is this comic which you have titled " Folow my dreams , son " , which was about a boy who wanted to become a footballer , but ends up getting a degree from FFS College of Engineering .
So were there some challenges with your ...
Absolutely not !
My parents have been super supportive from the start .
Like they actually told me to leave studies and go for art because I was so passionate about art and design .
So I have had a very very smooth sailing so far .
No parental pressure at all .
It has been amazing , yeah .
If you had something to tell to your younger self , about your webcomics , what would you tell ?
Read more .
Right now I am reading a lot of different kinds of comics so I can look at different ways of story telling .
If I had done that earlier , maybe I could have , maybe , I do n't know , some stories could have turned out better .
When I look at some of my older comics , I feel like , ' Okay this could have been done a little better ' sometimes .
So , that 's it .
Otherwise nothing .
Like I said , I had a smooth life , I do n't give a f ...
